1.name: Heavy Attack
1.description: Moves triggered by holding down the Basic Attack button

2.name: Plunge Attack
2.description: Falling moves executed by using Basic Attacks from a certain height above the ground

3.name: Special attack
3.description: The most core and well-known signature skill move of the weapon

4.name: Expertise Skill
4.description: Skills and moves that can be freely combined and replaced with the weapon

5.name: Ultimate
5.description: The ultimate combat arcane of the most powerful weapon

7.name: Recovery skill
7.description: Skill that can be used when being hit and airborne

9.name: Direct DMG
9.description: Damage generated by the skill move itself

10.name: DoT
10.description: Skills that affect the target or leave a DMG area that persists for a period, causing continuous DMG that cannot trigger Luck effects (this type of healing cannot trigger Luck effect)

11.name: Direct healing
11.description: Healing generated by the skill or move itself

12.name: HOT
12.description: Skills that affect the target or leave a healing area that persists for a period, causing the target to continuously restore HP (this type of healing cannot trigger Luck effects)

13.name: Blessing
13.description: In an advantageous state where combat, movement, or other abilities are enhanced

14.name: Exaltation
14.description: An effect that significantly boosts combat ability for a short period of time

15.name: Inspiration
15.description: Combat attributes are greatly enhanced, and if developed under talents, additional effects will be added

16.name: Weakness
16.description: In a disadvantageous state where combat, movement, or other abilities are reduced

17.name: Vulnerability
17.description: A detrimental effect that increases damage taken for a period of time

18.name: Fracture
18.description: Increases damage taken for a period of time, with additional effects if developed under certain talents

19.name: Frozen
19.description: In a state where movement and any combat actions are impossible

20.name: Bind
20.description: In a state where movement is impossible

21.name: Stun
21.description: In a state of immobility, unable to perform any combat actions, and unable to use items

22.name: Slow
22.description: In a state of reduced Speed

23.name: Stagger
23.description: The ability to break the super armor bar of a powerful target

26.name: Shield
26.description: Additional health shield that absorbs damage before health

27.name: Block
27.description: A special phase of a skill where damage taken is partially mitigated

28.name: Fire
28.description: Skill carries the power of the Fire

29.name: Ice
29.description: Skill carries the power of the Ice

30.name: Thunder Element
30.description: Skills imbued with the power of the Thunder Element

31.name: Wind
31.description: Skills imbued with the power of the Wind

32.name: Rock
32.description: Skills imbued with the power of the Rock

33.name: Forest
33.description: Skills imbued with the power of the Forest

34.name: Light
34.description: Skills imbued with the power of the Light

35.name: Dark
35.description: Skills imbued with the power of the Dark

36.name: Coordination
36.description: Effects that synchronize attack actions with the battle

37.name: Cooperative Battle
37.description: Effects that independently perform attacks to assist in combat

38.name: Charging
38.description: A skill release method that requires some time to prepare to achieve stronger power

39.name: Channelling
39.description: A skill release method that requires maintaining a casting state to continue the effect

40.name: Enhancement
40.description: Skills in a state of being enhanced or producing changes

41.name: Energy Restore
41.description: Can obtain combat resources needed for certain skill releases

42.name: Imprint
42.description: A type of effect that can be triggered under specific conditions, with the trigger probability influenced by attributes

43.name: Suppress
43.description: A state when one's health is higher than the target's health, providing damage and Defense bonuses, and if developed under talents, additional effects will be added

44.name: Trap
44.description: A summon that produces effects after certain conditions are triggered

45.name: Totem
45.description: A summon that remains stationary for a period of time and produces effects around it

46.name: Companion
46.description: A summon that can move and follow the summoner to assist in combat

47.name: Construct
47.description: A summon with collision that can change terrain

50.name: Domain
50.description: Area effect that can continuously provide beneficial status to oneself or allies

51.name: AoE
51.description: Area effect that can continuously cause damage or adverse status to enemies

52.name: Aura
52.description: Can continuously provide effects to targets within its own range

53.name: Normal monster
53.description: monsters active on the continent, generally with basic combat abilities

54.name: Elite
54.description: Outstanding warriors among monsters, generally possessing highly threatening Expertise

55.name: Boss
55.description: The absolute strong in the group, can be called a king without exaggeration

56.name: Wild Boss
56.description: Powerful monsters found only in special territorial areas on the map

57.name: World Boss
57.description: The most powerful monster in dungeon maps

58.name: Healthy
58.description: Status where health is not less than 50% of the health cap

59.name: Injured
59.description: Status where health is not more than 30% of the health cap

60.name: Goblin
60.description:
He crouched down and started digging with his hands.
Soon, he unearthed a box with a letter inside.

62.name: No element
62.description: Skills not imbued with elemental power

63.name: Corrosion
63.description: Affected by an unknown source of contamination, causing various adverse effects

64.name: Strong Control
64.description: Strong control over targets without super armor value

65.name: Counterattack
65.description: Attack after successful red light counter

66.name: Physical
66.description: Damage is physical, affected by Block

67.name: Magic
67.description: Damage is magic, not affected by Block

68.name: Single target
68.description: When there are fewer targets, the effect is stronger (if dealing damage, damage to the primary target does not diminish, but damage to other targets diminishes sharply)

69.name: AoE
69.description: Triggers a stronger effect when there are many targets (if it causes DMG, the DMG to all targets diminishes simultaneously)

70.name: Chanting
70.description: A skill release method that requires some time to prepare before releasing

71.name: Crit
71.description: In a state of increased Crit

72.name: Luck
72.description: In a state of increased luck

73.name: Acceleration
73.description: In a state of reduced CD

74.name: Mastery
74.description: In a state of increased mastery

75.name: Increased damage
75.description: In an advantageous state where DMG-dealing ability is enhanced

76.name: Protect
76.description: In a state of increased survivability

77.name: Attack Reduction
77.description: In a state of reduced offensive capability

78.name: Armor Reduce
78.description: In a state of reduced survivability

79.name: Envelop
79.description: In a state of immobility, unable to perform any combat actions, and continuously being knocked back and attracted

81.name: Haste
81.description: In a state of increased haste

82.name: Wild Monster
82.description: Use to mark wild monsters, level Suppress calculation formula used

83.name: Silence
83.description: In a state of being unable to perform any combat actions

85.name: Wound
85.description: In a state of reduced Healingiveness

86.name: Toy and Mount Skills
86.description:
He crouched down and started digging with his hands.
Soon, he unearthed a box with a letter inside.

87.name: Transformation skill
87.description: Use to mark transformation buffs, use the exit button to remove all transformation buffs with this tag.

88.name: Lucky Effect DMG
88.description: DMG caused by Lucky Effects triggered by skills (When using class skills that deal direct DMG or healing, all Lucky Effects you possess have a chance to trigger equal to your Luck Rate)

89.name: Lucky Strike Healing
89.description: Healing caused by Lucky Effects triggered by skills (When using class skills that deal direct DMG or healing, all Lucky Effects you possess have a chance to trigger equal to your Luck Rate)

90.name: Main attribute
90.description: In a beneficial state of main attribute enhancement

91.name: Summon
91.description: A basic combat unit that repeatedly uses relatively simple skills

92.name: Healing Boost
92.description: In a state that increases Healingiveness

93.name: Melee
93.description: The skill only affects targets within close range

94.name: Ranged
94.description: The skill remains effective even at a longer distance from the target

95.name: Curse Stats
95.description: A type of buff used in roguelike gameplay

96.name: Bouncing Bullet
96.description: Skill marker used in roguelike gameplay

140.name: Scenario Skill
140.description: Additional skills obtained through scenarios or level gameplay

201.name: Field Boss
201.description: Quest: Participate in killing a specific type of monster

202.name: Wild
202.description:
He crouched down and started digging with his hands.
Soon, he unearthed a box with a letter inside.

1001.name: Normal Attack
1001.description: Various moves triggered by the Basic Attack button

1002.name: Damage
1002.description: Effects that cause targets to lose HP

1003.name: Healing
1003.description: Effects that restore the target's HP

1004.name: Buff
1004.description: An effect that can be beneficial to allies in combat

1005.name: Debuff
1005.description: In various states that are disadvantageous to one's own combat

1006.name: Control
1006.description: In a state where various actions are restricted

1007.name: Displacement
1007.description: Skills that help characters move quickly

1008.name: Survival
1008.description: Skills that can help the character survive

1017.name: Assist in Battle
1017.description: Auxiliary effects that can generate additional attack actions or resist offensive actions

1018.name: Summon
1018.description: Can summon combat units influenced by the summoner's state

1019.name: Projectile
1019.description: A skill mechanism that can perform physical motion and produce effects upon hitting

1020.name: Area Effect
1020.description: Effective method within a specified range

1022.name: Boss
1022.description: Boss, Wild Boss, and World Boss
